transcript.text: Shalom Shalom Shalom it is now the
seventh day of Hanukkah the evening the
night of january second 2013 it is the
now second day of the tenth hebrew month
and the seventh day of Hanukkah Thursday
night going to friday the happy
preparation day of course this sabbath
which starts tomorrow night friday night
all day saturday that'll be the eighth
and last day of Hanukkah remember
Hanukkah was celebrated by Yahshua in
John chapter 10 verse 22 remember
Hanukkah is a time where after the
temple was cleansed it was then
sanctified for eight days is your temple
sanctified are you living holy has
Yahshua's Holy Spirit the burning oil of
a spirit filled your temple so that
you're no longer in sin but actually
living holy with a faith unfeigned or
are you still struggling with sin
whomsoever the son sets free is free
indeed joshua has set us free from all
sins so you should be living holy and
pure and without sin this is what the
Hanukkah is all about it's about living
purity member Yahshua said in Matthew 5
only the pure in heart will see yah well
if you're still sinning you're not pure
in heart make sure Yash was seated on
the throne of your heart that the oil of
His Holy Spirit is burning on the
menorah of your heart and that your
temple your body your soul and spirit
and body are clean and pure and only by
relying on Yahshua day in a day out can
you live this way how do we live sinless
by every day relying on him and working
out our relationship with him on a daily
basis this is how we live sinless it's
the only way to live sinless we have to
be relying on him moment by moment day
by day but if you can don't go a day
without sin you can go a week without
sin if you can go a week without sin you
can go a year without sin you can go a
year without sin you can go the rest of
your life without sin even as David
cried out in psalm 119 I will keep your
coming
forever I will do no iniquity this is
daniel john lee with tour restoration
ministries the websites ww spirit and
tour com you can click on it below in
the About description of the video
remember the true meaning of Hanukkah is
that we live holy because Yahshua lives
within us and teaches us and helps us to
overcome all temptation to sin and to
live holy each and every day Happy
Hanukkah from Daniel and Don leads at
Tora restoration ministries Shalom
